Here's a question for you: why would God give someone gay tendencies and force him to live a life without love to avoid sinning when God's top lesson was love? Why would he do that to his "child" who he "loves"? It seems rather cruel for a loving Father. Also, Jesus never said anything about it. The son of God didn't seem to care at all. I don't care if you think it's a sin personally. I gracefully disagree. However, pointing one "sin" over the other is wrong regardless. Don't point out a speck in someone's eye when you have a log in yours. You can throw stones when you're sinless.....oh wait.
trueXD
